Name: Lindum Oredalen
ParentCompany: Lindum AS (51%), Asker Komune ( 49% owner), Drammen Kommune, Lindum AS
MassesAccepted:
Contaminated soil and excavation masses
PFAS-contaminated masses (non-hazardous)
Concrete waste
Bottom ash (bunnaske) from incineration plants
Asbestos (properly packaged)
Ordinary (non-hazardous) waste
Sewage sludge treatment
Stable, non-reactive hazardous waste (under conditions)
MassesProduced: Treated and stabilized waste for permanent safe storage
Contaminants: PFAS (per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances), heavy metals, asbestos, bottom ash contaminants, various industrial pollutant
Description: Modern landfill facility specializing in treatment and disposal of contaminated masses, particularly PFAS-contaminated soil since 2020. Features advanced leachate treatment, double bottom and side sealing with bentonite and HDPE membranes. Regarded as industry example of best practice modern landfill
Description_NO: Moderne deponi for behandling og deponering av forurensede masser, spesialiser ing på PFAS-forurensede jordmasser. Har avansert sigevannsrensing, dobbel bunn- og sidetetting med bentonittmembraner og HDPE-membraner. Anses som bransjens eksempel på beste praksis moderne deponi.

Name: Røyken Grovfyllplass
ParentCompany: FFF Hage og Miljø AS, Franzefoss Gjenvinning AS, Franzefoss AS
MassesAccepted: Pre-treated residual waste, sand trap sludge, bottom ash, slag, compost, sandblasting waste, and asbestos
AnnualCapacity: 17,000 tonnes ( non specified new annual limit set )
Description: Established in 1990, Røyken Grovfyllplass AS is a regional landfill for ordinary waste located in Asker (formerly Røyken). The landfill is managed by a the construction company FFF HAGE OG MILJO AS. Despite a permit allowing operations until 2050, the facility has faced persistent local opposition and regulatory fines due to odor complaints and inadequate leachate (contaminated water) treatment. Recent 2021 and 2023 inspections confirmed ongoing non-compliance regarding emissions into the local stream, Smedmyrbekken.
Description_NO: Røyken Grovfyllplass AS ble etablert i 1990 og er et regionalt deponi for ordinært avfall i Asker. Selv om tillatelsen varer frem til 2050, har anlegget møtt vedvarende motstand fra naboer og fått bøter for luktplager og mangelfull rensing av sigevann. Tilsyn i 2021 og 2023 bekreftet avvik knyttet til utslippsrutiner og forurensning av Smedmyrbekken.
Notes: The surroundings are becoming a industrial park, there is a need to check how they have evolved, and if the old permiter has reduced. Whats the conection one to the other. Its the same company, they buildt it together
